ledsa.analysis.calculations module¶

ledsa.analysis.calculations.calculate_average_fitpar_without_smoke(parameter, channel, num_of_imgs=20)¶

Calculate the average of parameter over the first num_of_imgs images for every led.

Return type

Series

ledsa.analysis.calculations.clean_bin_data(channel)¶

Remove the binary parameter file for channel.

ledsa.analysis.calculations.create_binary_data(channel)¶

Compress all generated parameter csv files into a binary data object.

Return type

None

ledsa.analysis.calculations.include_column_if_nonexistent(parameters, parameter, channel)¶

Check if paramerter is in the parameter DF and add it if it is not. Only parameters in the form of normalized_$PARAMETER can be added. :returns old or updated parameter DataFrame.

Return type

DataFrame

ledsa.analysis.calculations.multiindex_series_to_nparray(multi_series)¶

Convert pd multi-index series to numpy array.

Return type

ndarray

ledsa.analysis.calculations.normalize_parameter(parameter, channel)¶

Add a normalized version of parameter to the parameter binary file.

Return type

None

ledsa.analysis.calculations.read_hdf(channel, path='.')¶

Read the parameter binary file or create it, if the file is not found. :returns DataFrame with all Parameters and multiindex [‘img_id’, ‘led_id’]

Return type

DataFrame

Plot a single led and the corresponding fit function.

Plot the time development of parameter and its moving average.

Return type

None

ledsa.analysis.plot_functions.plot_z_fitpar_from_average(fig, parameter, img_id, channel, led_arrays, window_size=51)¶

Plot the hight of a led array against an parameter averaged over multiple images.

Some functions simplifying the visualization of the data.

ledsa.analysis.plot_functions.show_img(img_id=- 1, time=- 1)¶

Add the image corresponding to time or with id img_id to the current plot.

ledsa.analysis.plot_functions.show_led_diff(channel, led_id, time1, time2, window_radius=10)¶

Plot the difference of the led color value for one led at two different times.
